conclusion: Determine the radius R of the circular path of the particle in the magnetic field.
Determine the velocity of the particle as it exits the electric field region and enters the magnetic field region.
The particle is accelerated by the electric field between plates M and N.
Using the principle of conservation of energy, the work done by the electric field U on the particle is equal to its kinetic energy.
The voltage U between the plates gives the particle energy qU, where q is the charge of the particle.
The kinetic energy of the particle is (1/2)mv^2.
Determine the radius R of the circular path in the magnetic field.
The magnetic force qvB provides the centripetal force required to keep the particle moving in a circular path.
The centripetal force is given by (mv^2)/R.
From step 1, we have v = sqrt(2qU/m).
The radius R of the circular path of the particle in the magnetic field is R = (1/B) * sqrt(2mU/q).
